understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method that returns the batch size failure threshold in kilobytes.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is directly accessing a configuration parameter 'batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb' to determine the batch size failure threshold. This configuration parameter is used to set the threshold for failing any multiple-partition batch that exceeds the specified value, which is 50kb by default.

config_description: Fail any multiple-partition batch exceeding this value. 50kb (10x warn threshold) by default.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb' is used to determine the threshold at which a multiple-partition batch will fail. It is set to 50kb by default, and any batch exceeding this value will fail.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever a batch operation is performed that involves multiple partitions. The frequency of triggering depends on the frequency of such batch operations in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the configuration option is that it helps prevent large batches from causing performance issues or failures in the system. By setting a threshold, it ensures that batches are kept within manageable sizes.
